title: Bega Cheese loses another big slice with profit warning
text:
Bega Cheese has warned that drought and weaker demand for export products will eat into its profits even more than first thought over the next 12 months.

The profit warning came as the battle between processors over a dwindling milk pool continues to push up the price they must pay farmers to secure supply.

Bega said on Tuesday that it had been hit by unprecedented competition for milk supply and weaker demand from third-party branded businesses.

The Bega share price fell more than 12 per cent to $3.98 in early trading after the milk processor and food maker said it now expected normalised earnings before interest, tax, amortisation and depreciation of between $95 million and $115 million for 2019-20, compared to $115 million in fiscal 2019.

The 2019 result was much weaker than the $123 million to $130 million forecast by Bega at the half-year mark, but in line with a downgrade issued in early August as the milk supply continued to dry up.

Bega chairman Max Roberts said the supply and competition issues flagged by the company had become worse sooner than expected.
description: The dairy processor warns drought-related competition for milk is hitting even harder and faster than expected.
